Tom usually plans his <blank text=33> for a week. And then he buys all the food in the supermarket. Jim, Peter and Alan don't plan ahead. They often eat fast food. Four boys get on well, but here is a <blank text=34> -snacks （零食）. Jim, Peter and Alan often eat Tom's snacks. Tom doesn't like that.

The next day, Tom opened the refrigerator. The bag was gone! He felt very <blank text=37>. Minutes later he found the empty（空的）bag in Max's dog plate! He knew Max <blank text=38> open the refrigerator.
Tom went to Jim's room. "Jim, what happened to my snack in the bag?" he asked.

questions.explanation: 'Shares' means to have or use something jointly with another or others, which fits the context of living in an apartment.
'Because' indicates the reason why they don't have meals together, which is that their schedules are very different.
Planning 'meals' makes the most sense in the context of buying food in the supermarket.
'Problem' fits the context as the sentence introduces an issue about snacks being eaten by others.
'Also' indicates that the other boys similarly liked the snack, fitting the context of the sentence.
'Do not mind!' is the most appropriate in the context, meaning 'don't eat it'.
Finding that his snack was gone would likely make Tom 'angry'.
'Couldn't' indicates an impossibility, which is appropriate in saying that the dog couldn't open the refrigerator.
'Ask' is the appropriate verb to inquire whether he had already asked Alan or Peter, given the dialogue's question-answer structure.
'He' refers to Max, the dog, as it follows the prior sentence where it is revealed that the pudding is Max's favorite.

Without the animals, the garden was not <blank text=12> before. The king was sad, but he didn’t know what had happened.
A young man went to the king, and said he could <blank text=13> what had happened. “This was because you cut the old tree down.” said the young man. “There <blank text=14> some moths（飞蛾）living in the old tree. Birds needed to eat the moths and then they produced wastes for plants to grow. The plants then attracted many <blank text=15> animals to your garden. The animals wouldn’t leave your garden <blank text=16> you cut down the tree. So the tree is important <blank text=17> your garden because it can make your garden beautiful.”

questions.explanation: 'anyone else' means anybody else. The sentence means he was happier than anybody else.
'enjoy themselves' is a fixed phrase, meaning to have a good time.
Since the adjective 'old' starts with a vowel sound, the article 'an' should be used.
'so...that...' is a sentence pattern. It means 'so...that...'.
'order somebody to do something' means order somebody to do something.

The sentence before the blank means the king cut the tree down, and the sentence after the blank means the animals left the garden. So there is a cause-and-effect relationship between the two sentences, so 'So' should be used.
'as + adjective + as' is a sentence pattern. It means 'as...as...'.
'could do something' means could do something.
Because the moths are plural, the plural form of 'be' verb 'were' should be used.
Since the word after the blank is a plural noun, 'other' should be used.
Unless = if not. The sentence means the animals wouldn’t leave your garden if you didn’t cut down the tree.
'important to' means important to.
'make somebody do something' means make somebody do something.
Since the sentence is talking about the future, 'will take' should be used.
The time the king realized the importance of the tree is the only time, so 'the one' should be used.

question_sets.context:
My mother used to ask me what is the most important part of the body. Through the years I kept trying to give the correct answer.
When I was younger, I thought 11 was very important to us as humans, so I said, ＂My ears, Mommy.＂
She said, ＂No. Many people are deaf. Keep thinking about it and I will ask you again.＂ Several years 12, she asked me again. This time I told her, ＂Mommy, sight is very important to 13, so it must be our 14.＂
She 15 me and told me, ＂You are learning fast, 16 the answer is not correct because there are many people who are blind.＂
Over the next few years, she asked me a few more times and always her answer was, ＂ 17, but you are getting smarter every year, my child.＂
Then last year, my grandpa 18. Everybody was hurt, and everybody was crying. My mom asked me, ＂Do you know the most important body part yet, my dear?＂
I was greatly 19 when she asked me this now. I always thought this was a 20 between her and me. She saw the confusion(困惑) on my face and told me, ＂This 21 is very important. It shows that you have 22 lived your life.＂ I saw her eyes filled up with tears. She said, ＂My dear, the most important body part is your shoulder.＂
I asked, ＂Is it because it 23 your head?＂
She replied, ＂No, it is because it can hold the head of a friend or loved one when they 24. Everybody needs a shoulder to cry on sometimes in life, my clear. I only hope that you will have a shoulder to cry on when you need it.＂
Then and there, I knew the most important body part is not a 25 one. It is sympathetic(同情的) to the pain of others.

questions.explanation: The following sentence mentions "My ears", indicating the child initially thought sound was important.
'Later' indicates a passage of time before she asked again.
Sight is important to all people, thus 'everyone' is the appropriate choice.
Since sight is being discussed, 'eyes' is the body part associated with it.
'Looked at' implies she observed the child before responding.
'But' introduces a contrasting statement - that the answer is still incorrect.
The mother is negating the child's answer, making 'No' the correct response.
'Passed away' is a polite way to say someone died.
The child was taken aback when asked the question at such a sad time, implying surprise.
The child viewed the question as a lighthearted 'game' between them.
The mother is emphasizing the importance of the specific 'question' she's asking.
The shoulder symbolizes having 'really' lived a full and meaningful life.
'Holds up' means to support, which is the function of the shoulder in this context.
The shoulder provides comfort when someone is 'crying'.
The important body part is not 'selfish', but rather empathetic and caring.

    Those simple（7）　   　 changed me． They planted a seed （种子） in my heart that continues to（8）　   　 to this day． They made me realize that I had something good （9）　   　 of me． I just had to find it and share it．
    Can you change the world？ Yes， you can! You can change it through one choice， one person， and one kind （10）　   　 at a time． All you have to do is share your goodness． Mother Teresa once said， "God doesn't ask us to do great things， only small things with great love． So make your love great!"

questions.explanation: Based on the context, the friend felt negative at the time, so 'sadly' is the best choice.
The friend questions whether they can really change the crazy world.
The author strongly affirms that they can change the world, so 'certainly' is the best choice.
The teacher is mentioned as the first teacher at the elementary school.
The author didn't know how to play any instruments.
The author put down the guitar after trying to play it.
The teacher's simple words changed the author.
The seed planted in the author's heart continues to grow.
The author realized that they had something good inside of them.
The world can be changed through one choice, one person, and one kind deed at a time.

question_sets.context: Everyone has an ambition. My ambition is <blank text=36> a doctor. I was born in a small village. My parents worked in a town nearby. They had no time to look <blank text=37> me. So I lived with my <blank text=38> . My grandmother was kind. She loved and took <blank text=39> care of me every day. But one day <blank text=40> I was six years old, my grandmother <blank text=41> ill. We took her to hospital in the town, but she was very ill and a month later she died. <blank text=42> sad we were! “If I were a doctor, I would save her.” I thought at that time. From then on, I <blank text=43> to study hard and try to learn <blank text=44> at school and wanted to become a doctor. When I am a doctor, I can help the patients and make them <blank text=45> good health again. And I can make their families happy and live a happy life.

questions.explanation: Ambition is to do sth. We should use 'to be'.
Look after means take care of.
According to the following context, it should be grandma.
Take good care of.
When is used to indicate a time.
Got ill is used to indicate that something happens.
How + adj./adv. + S + V! is used to describe something.
Decide to do sth.
Learn a lot of.
Make them be good health.

question_sets.context:
A: Hello, Julia! You were not at school yesterday, Were you ill?
B: Yes, I was. My mother took me to the hospital.
A: <blank text=56>
B: Much better. Thank you. You are always healthy. Why?
A: <blank text=57>
B: Really? <blank text=58>
A: I exercise every day.
B: <blank text=59>
A: I like running best.
B: What about your lifestyle?
A: <blank text=60>. I eat a lot of fruit and vegetables. I never eat junk food. I sleep eight hours every night.
B: You are right. I should learn from you and keep healthy.

choices.C: Do you eat junk food very often?
choices.D: How often do you exercise? How often do you drink milk? What’s your favourite sport? How are you feeling now?

questions.explanation: Julia just came back from the hospital, so it is polite to ask her 'How are you feeling now?'

choices.C: Do you eat junk food very often?
choices.D: How often do you exercise? How often do you drink milk? What’s your favourite sport? How are you feeling now?

questions.explanation: B's response says 'You are always healthy. Why?' A should explain why he is healthy. Because I often exercise is the best choice.

choices.C: Do you eat junk food very often?
choices.D: How often do you exercise? How often do you drink milk? What’s your favourite sport? How are you feeling now?

questions.explanation: How often do you exercise shows that B is interested in exercising.

choices.C: Do you eat junk food very often?
choices.D: How often do you exercise? How often do you drink milk? What’s your favourite sport? How are you feeling now?

questions.explanation: B is asking about A's favorite sport.

choices.C: Do you eat junk food very often?
choices.D: How often do you exercise? How often do you drink milk? What’s your favourite sport? How are you feeling now?

questions.explanation: A is describing his lifestyle in detail.
